intro: Cochleata scutellata, commonly known as the shield-fruited snailgrass, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, spicy scent. Cochleata scutellata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
